page.title: 03Worths Farm,Holbeach Hurn.
page.content: At the end of the last century Mr.Arthur Worth helped pioneer the drainage of the marshes,introduce artificial fertilisers,chemical fungicide and virus free potatoes.He built his own railway linking every field to the main line at Fleet.He started with a 6 yr. rotation but now there is an 8 yr.rotation.In 1968 the Holbeach Marsh Cooperative was formed,run by Worths but comprising 15 local farmers.They grow 1000 acres of potatoes,2500 acres of peas,and cereal crops,sugar beet,and in 1985 for the first time "mange tout"peas.They grow for their own freezer company and the big chain stores and for animal feed.They have their own 5 day weather station which can predict disease in crops.Nowadays most of their sprays are organic and they provide plenty of untouched cover for wild life.
